file_content.text: The sands of Tatooine await you, apprentice. I have gleaned much since our interrogation of the Republic agent here on Dromund Kaas.
I am certain Nomen Karr brought his gifted Padawan to Tatooine to train with a legendary Master named Yonlach.
I have deduced that Nomen Karr brought his Padawan Jaesa Willsaam to Tatooine to train with a legendary Master named Yonlach.
Years ago, I urged the Dark Council to hunt down and destroy this Jedi. They refused, and Yonlach went into hiding on Tatooine.
What should I do with him once I track him down?
So, you want me to find him.
Now I have to mop up the Council's mistake?
In other words they blew it.
It won't be the last time. The Dark Council often lacks foresight.
He's hiding in the desert. Why does this coward Jedi concern us?
Why is this Yonlach a concern?
He was the greatest Jedi teacher of his time. The Force remains strong in him.
Yonlach is the one who brought the Padawan's powers into expression. Now, they share a special bond. Find him and destroy him.
I will bring the old man to his knees.
My pleasure.
First Jaesa's parents, now the patron of her training.
Just as I did on Alderaan.
What do you hope to achieve by doing this?
To what purpose?
Nomen Karr shelters his prize, so we will draw her out by destroying everything she loves.
Any idea where I should start?
My servant Sharack Breev will guide you--she's eccentric, an acquired taste--but give her the benefit of the doubt.
Understood.
If I can, I will.
I will often indulge your whims, apprentice, as long as you deliver results. But in this case, mold yourself closely to my commands.
I'll give her what she needs to do the job at hand.
I'm not into charity.
And I'm telling you, what she needs is your tolerance.
That is all.
